title: "Alderney" unknown fractur typeface...
content:
Hi there every one, this is my first post on typophile.com   
I'm looking for this specificfont, but I cant seem to find it anywhere,   
Regards   
Klaus   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110024042im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32155.jpg)
author: eternty

comments.content:
No matches at DaFont or in the FontBook either.   
   
Where did you get the sample?
[Curious Nicolai, I just made the same question at the same time!](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110024042/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32148.html?1080401085)

While waiting for the blackletter expert (Andreas Seidel) to show up,   
you might wanna have look in the [Blackletter](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110024042/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/4077/4803.html?1080238133) section.

Well the sample was pulled from .pdf boolet I downloaded   
from game studio white wolf.   
they name the font DarkAgesVampire, but I have a feeling that it's not it's original name...   
hope you can help me out, I'm creating a flyer for a skate store a friend of mine owns, he showd up with the pdf and told me that he wanted to use it.   
   
Regards   
Klaus   
and thanks for all the speedy replies...

If you're feeling ambitious, here's a site with heaps of gothic fonts. I'm not gonna find it for you though:   
   
 [http://jeff.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/gothic.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110024042/http:/jeff.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/gothic.html)   
   
(I googled DarkAges)
Ignacio, here instead of name, rank and serial number it should be where and when did you get the sample. It seems many of these requests are predigital
